name: David Larsen
bio:
Poet and translator David Larsen is the author of the poetry collection The Thorn (Faux Press, 2005). He earned his PhD in comparative literature at University of California, Berkeley under the supervision of Leslie Kurke. He curated an experimental poetry and video series in Oakland and was active as a self-publisher and linocut artist, contributing hand-printed covers to the ten-issue run of Katy Lederer’s Explosive Magazine.

Since leaving the San Francisco Bay Area in 2008, Larsen has specialized as a scholar of pre-modern Arabic literature. During Egypt’s 2011 uprising he was a Fulbright research fellow in Cairo. His translation of Ibn Khalawayh’s Names of the Lion (Wave Books, 2017) won the Harold Morton Landon Translation Award from the Academy of American Poets.

Larsen lives in New York City and teaches at New York University.
